cytoscape.editor.event
Class BasicNetworkEditEventHandler

java.lang.Object
  PBasicInputEventHandler
      cytoscape.editor.event.NetworkEditEventAdapter
          cytoscape.editor.event.BasicNetworkEditEventHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
PaletteNetworkEditEventHandler
public class BasicNetworkEditEventHandler
extends NetworkEditEventAdapter
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

The BasicNetworkEditEventHandler class provides specialized methods defining the behavior of the basic Cytoscape editor provided in Cytoscape 2.2. The behavior is defined in terms of how the event handler responds to mouse events, drag/drop events, and button press events.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Allan Kuchinsky
See Also:
BasicCytoscapeEditor, Serialized Form

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(PInputEvent e)
The mousePressed() method is at the heart of the basic Cytoscape editor. If the editor is in "ADD_MODE" due to a mouse press on the 'Add node' button, subsequent mousePressed() events on the canvas create nodes with default labels. The default label appears in an editable text field and can be edited.

If the editor is in "CONNECT_MODE", then user clicks when over the desired source node, moves the mouse to the desired target node, and clicks the mouse when over the desired target node.

There are also accelerators for modeless addition of nodes and edges. Control-clicking at a position on the canvas creates a node with default label in that position. The default label appears in an editable text field, so the user can edit its name immediately by just beginning to type. Hit ENTER or click (or control-click) anywhere outside the field, and the edited field is assigned as the label for the node. Control-clicking on a node on the canvas starts an edge with source at that node. Move the cursor and a rubber-banded line follows the cursor. As the cursor passes over another node, that node is highlighted and the rubber-banded line will snap to a connection point on that second node. Control-click the mouse again and the connection is established.

Overrides:
mousePressed in class NetworkEditEventAdapter
See Also:
BasicCytoscapeEditor
